intro: Hamiltonia pilosa, commonly known as the hairy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, hairy flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, humid climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Hamiltonia pilosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
